Miles Sound System SDK 6.1c

AIL_set_sample_file

The function AIL_set_sample_file initializes a sample's address, length, type, and flags to prepare for playback of a memory-resident .

S32 AIL_set_sample_file(
  HSAMPLE S,
  void const * file_image,
  S32 block
);

In Parameters

S
indicates the sample to prepare for .VOC or .WAV file playback.
file_image
points to the start of the file image in memory.
block
specifies a block number to play in the file. block is ignored with formats for which MSS does not support multiple blocks, such as the .WAV format.

Returns

0 if the file could not be parsed or if the desired block was not found; otherwise, a non-zero return value indicates the sample handle was successfully prepared for file playback.

Discussion

VOC file, uncompressed .WAV file, IMA ADPCM compressed .WAV file, or .WAV-wrapped MPEG Layer 3 file.

This function is identical to AIL_allocate_file_sample, except that it uses an existing HSAMPLE handle rather than allocating a new one. AIL_set_sample_file may be more appropriate for applications which need to maintain control over file handle management for memory-resident .VOC or .WAV file playback.

This function will only load an MPEG Layer-3 file if it is wrapped in a Microsoft WAVE header wrapper. To load a standard MP3 file, use the AIL_set_named_sample_file function.

It is not necessary to call AIL_set_sample_type, AIL_set_sample_playback_rate, or AIL_set_sample_address when using this function. However, the sample handle passed to AIL_set_sample_file must first have been initialized with a call to AIL_init_sample.
